22-020TI.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes from the Technology & Innovation Commission special meeting held Wednesday, July 6, 2022.This agenda item was approved.Yes: 4 - Lisa Mae Brunson, Justin Hectus, Parisa Vinzant and Gwen ShafferAbsent: 1 - Robb Korinke22-021TIRecommendation to receive and file an update on the distribution of the Technology & Innovation Commission white paper titled "Analysis and recommendations for regulating facial recognition technology and other "smart" devices and platforms", and the Equity and Human Relations Commission recommendations related to the City's use of Facial Recognition Technology, and to discuss next steps for distribution and outreach for both documents.2.Page 1 of 3TELECONFERENCE, 3:30 PMWEDNESDAY, JULY 27, 2022CITY OF LONG BEACHTECHNOLOGY AND INNOVATION COMMISSION MINUTESLea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner Hectus, spoke.Lea Eriksen, Director of Technology & Innovation, spoke.Commissioner, Vinzant, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Commissioner Hectus, spoke.Vice Chair Brunson, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Erin Weesner-McKinley, Deputy City Attorney, spoke.Vice Chair Brunson, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.Vice Chair Brunson, spoke.Chair Shaffer, spoke.Commissioner Vinzant, spoke.This agenda item was approved.Yes: 5 - Lisa Mae Brunson, Justin Hectus, Parisa Vinzant, Gwen Shaffer and Robb Korinke3.
